alert.note: Alert for Kootenai (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 5:03AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: .Rain and melting snow today will contribute to rises on creeks and streams in north Idaho. Rock slides and mudslides in steep terrain may also be possible. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding possible as a result of rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah, Kootenai, Latah and Shoshone. * WHEN...Until noon PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Rock slides and mudslides in steep terrain are also possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 AM PST, Rain and snowmelt is occurring, with minor flooding possible. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are expected over the lower elevations, with 0.5 to 0.75 expected in the mountains. This additional rain could result in minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
